notes.EdgeCase: Edge case values such as r=1 and s=0 can lead to forgeries if the ECDSA implementation does not check boundaries and computes s^(-1)==0.
notes.PointDuplication: Some implementations of ECDSA do not handle duplication and points at infinity correctly. This is a test vector that has been specially crafted to check for such an omission.
notes.SigSize: The size of the signature should always be twice the number of bytes of the size of the order. But some libraries accept signatures with less bytes.
notes.WeakHash: The security strength of the hash function used in this signature is weaker than then strength of the EC parameters. Such choices are disallowed in FIPS PUB 186-4 Section 6.1.1. However, it is unclear whether a library should reject such parameter choices.
